result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joshua William Koeppler in court in custody with attorney Dan Firkus.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:08 pm w/18CF87
Atty Firkus - no resolution, deft wishes to have new counsel.
Court addressed Deft.
Parties discuss.
Court gives parties time to talk.
1:11 pm court recesses.
1:46 pm recess concludes.
Atty Firkus provides plea form.
Deft withdraws request for new counsel.
DA heard on agreement.
Court arraigns Deft Ct 1 w/o repeater.
Deft enters guilty plea.
Court arraigns Deft Ct 2 w/o repeater and enhancer.
Deft enters guilty plea.
Non-citizen advisory.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Restitution responsibility - 16CM34 of $507.10 includes 10% surcharge.
Deft understands.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-in 16CM34.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Firkus - satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters guilty plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty.
Court dismisses repeater on Ct 1 and dismisses repeater and enhancer Ct 2.  
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  Agent to provide the report to the Clerk of Courts office at least 10 days prior to sentencing.
2:01 pm off record.
2:02 pm back on record.
Court states date/time of sentencing hearing.
Court dismisses and reads in counts in 16CM34.
2:03 pm
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
